member.summary: This class will create an object of a given type and populate it with sample data.

member.name: M:Passion_Project.Areas.HelpPage.ObjectGenerator.GenerateObject(System.Type)
member.summary: Generates an object for a given type. The type needs to be public, have a public default constructor and settable public properties/fields. Currently it supports the following types: Simple types: , , , , , etc. Complex types: POCO types. Nullables: . Arrays: arrays of simple types or complex types. Key value pairs: Tuples: , , etc Dictionaries: or anything deriving from . Collections: , , , , , or anything deriving from or . Queryables: , .
member.returns: An object of the given type.

member.summary: Indicates whether the sample is used for request or response

member.name: M:Passion_Project.Controllers.AnimeDataController.FindAnime(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a particular anime in the system.
member.returns: HEADER: 200 (OK) CONTENT: An anime in the system matching up to the anime ID primary key or HEADER: 404 (NOT FOUND)
member.param: The primary key of the anime

member.name: M:Passion_Project.Controllers.AnimeDataController.UpdateAnime(System.Int32,Passion_Project.Models.Anime)
member.summary: Updates a particular anime in the system with POST Data input
member.param: Represents the Anime ID primary key
JSON FORM DATA of an anime
member.returns: HEADER: 204 (Success, No Content Response) or HEADER: 400 (Bad Request) or HEADER: 404 (Not Found)
member.example: POST: api/AnimeData/UpdateAnime/5 FORM DATA: Anime JSON Object

members.member:
Receives anime picture data, uploads it to the webserver and updates the anime's HasPic option
the anime id status code 200 if successful.
curl -F animepic=@file.jpg "https://localhost:xx/api/animedata/uploadanimepic/2" POST: api/animeData/UpdateanimePic/3 HEADER: enctype=multipart/form-data FORM-DATA: image
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/28369529/how-to-set-up-a-web-api-controller-for-multipart-form-data

member.name: M:Passion_Project.Controllers.AnimeDataController.AddAnime(Passion_Project.Models.Anime)
member.summary: Adds an anime to the system
member.param: JSON FORM DATA of an anime
member.returns: HEADER: 201 (Created) CONTENT: Anime ID, Anime Data or HEADER: 400 (Bad Request)
member.example: POST: api/AnimeData/AddAnime FORM DATA: Anime JSON Object

member.summary: Deletes an anime from the system by it's ID.
member.param: The primary key of the anime
member.returns: HEADER: 200 (OK) or HEADER: 404 (NOT FOUND)

member.name: M:Passion_Project.Controllers.ReviewController.GetApplicationCookie
member.summary:
Grabs the authentication cookie sent to this controller. For proper WebAPI authentication, you can send a post request with login credentials to the WebAPI and log the access token from the response. The controller already knows this token, so we're just passing it up the chain.
Here is a descriptive article which walks through the process of setting up authorization/authentication directly. https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/aspnet/web-api/overview/security/individual-accounts-in-web-api
